Title: the gyroscopic collapse

Penny: Champagne, champagne.
And for the world’s tallest second grader, apple juice.
Oh, I’m sorry to hear that.
Um, well, I, yeah, you got me.
And when? But also where?
Okay, we’re just gonna circle back to when he’s moving out? Okay, that’s cool.
Good for you.
Oh, come on, he’s a grown man, he can take care of himself.
Once again, you got me.
Oh, hey, what’s going on?
What?
Amy’s got some news.
Oh, sweetie, you might not live that long.
Oh, stop it, he’ll be fine.
Oh, damn, wait, you know, maybe you shouldn’t go.
I mean, I like a little brown sugar.
Sorry.
Oh, come on. Look, if the roles were reversed, he’d be on the first train to New Jersey, or the second train if there were teenagers on the first one.
Well, what’s wrong with that?
And yet you bore his child. Neato.
Okay, a simple yes will do.
Okay, listen to me. Your relationship can handle being long distance for a while. It’s not like you two are very physical.
A lot of lectures?
Oh, we would love that.
I want to, but I don’t think I can.
Okay, I’m good now.
Leonard: Thank you.
Hey, a toast. Thank you all for your support while we worked on our Air Force project. And please know that we could not have done it without you, so cheers.
First thing tomorrow morning, we’re back at it.
Hmm. I don’t care if this thing is burning out my retinas, it makes me feel special. Now, before we field test, I think we…
Where is everything?
It’s a secure lab in a classified facility, only the U.S. government and us.
Sir, I, I, I’m sorry but I just don’t get it. You came into our lab in the middle of the night and took our prototype and all of our research and didn’t even tell us?
Are you implementing phase two?
I can’t believe the Air Force would treat us like that.
Third floor, wrong apartment.
She might disappear, but she’s definitely not cleaning anything.
You won’t believe it, the military confiscated our project.
Yeah, what’s going on with you guys?
Oh, no. When?
So, are you excited to have your own place again?
Ah, we’ll miss you, too.
I’m trying. This is the best I can do. What are you doing?
Uh, could I talk to you in the hall for a sec?
Sheldon, you’re being silly.
Do you really care about that last one?
Instead of dwelling on the negative, think about this. Your girlfriend was given an amazing opportunity, which gives you an opportunity to show her that you’re a loving and supportive boyfriend.
All right, let me start again. Uh, you and Amy…
Thank you.
Should we give them their privacy?
Sheldon: Thank you. No bendy straw, some party.
To success without Raj.
Yeah, I’ll definitely live long enough. Vitamin C.
I hope his character doesn’t make it into the movie, he’s kind of a bummer.
Who else has access to this room?
This is disconcerting.
Where did you move it?
Wait, so you’re just going to take all the work we’ve done for the last year and toss us aside?
If that’s sarcasm, please save it for our enemies.
You know, I have a good mind to stop paying my taxes. It’s too bad I enjoy doing them so much. The Air Force did it again. They’re erasing our lives.
It’s okay, everything’s here.
I feel so betrayed. You know, all my life I thought Uncle Sam was a friendly uncle who brought you presents. Turns out he’s the other kind.
Thank you. Can we just talk about something else?
I apologize for exceeding my allotted bathroom time.
Not really. Apparently grief can make one less regular.
No, I sat and I sat, but to no avail.
What’s the occasion?
You’re so kind. You know, I don’t know how I ever got by without you.
Well, I thought that, too, but I’ve come to realize, I am completely dependent on you.
No, to wake up every morning and know you’re there is a great comfort to me. Mmm, tasteless. How do you do it?
Well, there is our quantum cognition experiment. You and I could spend more time on that.
I’m confused. You’re always saying that you want to spend more time with me.
Well, a lot, it’s very annoying. Has something changed? Um, is there something that you’re not telling me?
Princeton? A fine institution. The place where Albert Einstein taught. And where Leonard got his PhD, so it may have gone downhill.
Well, that’s wonderful. Congratulations.
What is there to talk about? You have to take it. It’s important.
Thank you, but I’ll be fine.

Yes. I may have lost my guidance system and my girlfriend, but I still have a colon full of yesterday’s meals to keep me company. Although, thanks to your high fibre breakfast, I’m sure that’ll be leaving me, too.
What does it look like? I’m playing sad harmonica in an apartment as empty as my heart.
I got the blues. My baby done left me.
Am I? Yesterday I had an Air Force project, a girlfriend who lived with me, and my good friend Raj right across the hall.
No, but that list was sounding a little thin.
So trick her.
No, but you are, so I got you this as a present.
No, it is. Leonard pointed out to me that I’m not always a loving and supportive boyfriend, so here’s some quality luggage.
The salesman said it could survive a plane crash, so perhaps you should fly inside it.

Well, I’m not looking forward to it, but it is a wonderful opportunity and you need to take it. Besides, Princeton is in New Jersey, so it’s not like you’re gonna want to stay. Uh, I know it’s not your birthday, but if you’re interested…
Okay. Oh, and just to be clear, I’m not being intimate with you in order to keep you from going.
Well, no, it’s just, I’m just warning you, you know, if you find yourself 3,000 miles away and craving a hit of this, you know, I can’t Skype it to you.
All right, then. Let’s go to the bedroom, remove our clothes, fold them neatly and engage in frenzied lovemaking.
Or, what if we fold them?
Of course. Here, here, let me. I’ve been doing a little research on New Jersey, and I was delighted to learn that their chief agricultural product is sod.
Hmm, yes. Yeah, perhaps I’ve been harder on them than they deserve.
It’s hard to say. I’ve never really lived by myself. What if I become strange and eccentric?
Howard Hughes saved his urine in milk bottles.
And you’ll text me when you arrive at the airport?
And when you’re at the gate?
And if you see any actors from Game of Thrones in first class?
And don’t forget to Skype me when you arrive.
And every morning.
Now of course, my 9am is your noon, so let’s avoid the whole good morning, good afternoon minefield, and let’s just say hello.
And just remember, I am proud of you and I support you in all that you do.

Oh, and one last thing. If you find yourself working with a male scientist who’s as smart as me, as tall as me and has hair like Thor, well, then I want you to step away from the situation and call me immediately.
Amy: You know, it’s nice of you to acknowledge us, but this is your accomplishment.
Where are you moving?
Well, good for you. I actually have a little news myself.
I was, uh, asked to be a visiting researcher at Princeton.
Thanks, but the thing is I’ll be gone for a few months and I don’t know how Sheldon’s gonna feel about that.
You really believe that?
Sheldon, I’m so sorry.
Yeah, um, Raj is moving out.
No, I’m waiting till he’s in a good mood.
I don’t know, maybe I shouldn’t go.
I guess. And he’ll have you and Leonard right across the hall the whole time.
Got to go. Morning.
Are you feeling okay?
Oh, I’m sorry to hear that.
Oh, the more details, the more sorry. Well, maybe this’ll cheer you up. I made your favorite oatmeal, plain.
No occasion, I just wanted to do something nice for you.
Oh. That’s sweet, but you, you did just fine on your own.
Sheldon, you’re, you’re being silly.
You know, what you need to do is put this Air Force project behind you and just dive into something new.
Oh, I don’t know, I mean, let’s say we succeed in proving that our consciousness creates reality. I mean, what will we have really accomplished? You know, a loaf of bread’s still three bucks.
That is true, I have said that.
I was offered a summer research fellowship at Princeton.
Yeah, that’s the one.
Well, I haven’t accepted it yet. I wanted to talk to you first.
So are you.
Are, are you sure?
I don’t think plain oatmeal was the point of that story.
Guys.
I don’t know. Sheldon’s so vulnerable right now.
Of course. I get to be part of the first team to use radon markers to map the structures that…
I know, but what if Sheldon…
Hey, you don’t know what goes on behind closed doors.
All right, so you know.
Hey. You going somewhere?
Sheldon, that isn’t necessary.
Thank you.
Does this mean you’re okay with me going?
I am.
I wasn’t thinking that.
That’s a risk I’m willing to take.
What if we don’t fold our clothes at all?
Okay, the car is waiting. Do you want to walk me downstairs?
Is it?
Do you think it’s possible you might enjoy being on your own for a little while?
I’ll love you no matter what.
We’ll cross that bridge when we come to it.
I will.
Uh-huh.
I don’t know what they look like, but sure.
I won’t.
Got it.
Good thinking.
Thank you. That means a lot.
Bernadette: Yeah, you guys did this all on your own.
So what happens next?
So you’re gonna be roommates with Bert?
Hey, that’s amazing.
You’re kidding. Why would they do that?
You doing okay?
Want me to put on some Neil Diamond? That always makes you feel better.
You might be forgetting another accomplishment of the past year.
Really? That’s the importance you put on us having a baby?
Really? He doesn’t put raisins or banana slices or anything in it?
You’re still gonna go, right?
Well, distance might be nice. The last time a big project ended for Howie, he wouldn’t stop following me around. He even went with me to get a mammogram.
No, he wanted to get one with me, like some kind of weird couple’s massage.
You’re excited about this opportunity, right?
You have to go.
I’m telling you, if you don’t go you’ll end up regretting it.
Oh, great.
Oh.
It’s too late for me. Save yourself.
Come here, let’s talk.
Just listen. I don’t know if you realize this, but whenever you’re between projects, you tend to get a little insecure.
A little clingy.
Oh, oh, oh, okay, stop. Stop. I love when you’re affectionate, but this is not coming from a good place.
I signed us up for ballroom dance class.
I made us have a baby.
Bring it in.
Raj: I may be moving out soon. I think I found a place to live.
Really? You kept sending me apartment listings.
Bert has a room for rent.
Uh, no, it’s, uh, pretty private, actually, it’s over his garage. So the only time I’ll see him is when he pulls his car in, does his laundry or practices drums in my dining room.
I am, but I’ll miss you guys.
You could try saying that without smiling.
Come on, Sheldon. Amy’s only gone for a few months. And now that I’m moving out, your old room is empty, so you can stay there whenever you want.
As soon as I have the place set up I’m gonna have you guys over.
I really can’t thank you enough for taking me in. You know, I was in a pretty low place in my life.
Anyway, uh, as I was saying, I was at a pretty low place in my life and, uh, if it wasn’t for friends
I can’t compete with that. Bye.
Howard: Phase two, we test it, perfect it, and hope to live long enough to see the movie based on our lives starring more attractive versions of us.
What the hell?
But the movie did just get good.
But why would you do that?
This is all very upsetting.
How can you work on something for a year and they just take it?
Although, if anyone’s gonna clean out your apartment and disappear, it’d be Penny.
They wouldn’t say.
Give us some good news.
Not really.
No. Then you’ll get all sexed up and I’m not in the mood. I mean, an entire year wasted.
Oh. Yeah, yeah, we brought life into the world.
I’m happy about it, but, I mean, it’s not like I did much. I mean, after the first three minutes it was pretty much all you.
Hey, wait up.
You left something at home. A big hug.
I found it right next to these kisses.
I missed you.
Ooh. Sounds serious. Have I been a bad boy? Am I gonna get a spanking ’cause you know.
Oh.
I know and I’m sorry.
Well, excuse me, but what did you do when you worked on that allergy drug for two years and the FDA shut down your project?
Okay, and what did you do when they took you off the antifungal team?
So?
And now the movie just got rated R.
Col. Williams: You guys completed phase one, we’ll take it from here.
I’m sorry to hear that. As you know, the primary focus of the United States military is people’s feelings.
Col: Williams: That one I can tell you, yes.
Penny (on phone): So, did you tell him about Princeton yet?
Raj (outside): Can I get my stuff? Sounds like it’s gonna be a while.
Amy (off): My goodness, that form of stimulation is highly efficient.
